intro: Cyrtandra pickeringii var. waiheae, commonly known as the Waihean Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. It is a perennial herb that often forms dense colonies, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
